review_title: Good for professional development but a tough place to work
pros:
- Staff at The Children's Home are given independence
- The compensation was fair for my field
- The amount of responsibility given to you will make you grow as a professional
- Wonderful facility to work in and free parking
- Staff DO care about the children and families they serve
cons: Big culture problems stemming from leadership. There's a general distrust of staff and a culture of finger pointing/blame. This can be exhausting, especially paired with the high expectations placed on you as an employee, and yes there are high expectations to perform. It is not unusual for management to actively monitor email inboxes without notice and survey personal social media accounts (which they have every right to do, but it creates a poor HR "perception"). Very unsupportive environment - burn out is frequent. Highly stressful. I would certainly not return.
